titleStmt.title: A. G. Waltz et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7489

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hon Thos. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

We the undersigned Jurors who tried chas Johnson at the november term of the Jefferson Circuit upon a charge of Grand Larceny (stealing from the person of W. C. Williams) & convicted him for two years, the lowest term, do most earnestly reccommend him to Your Clemency

A. G. Wattz
Wm. Haas
Thos M Fletcher
W. P. Chambers
Wm D Hogan
D, G, White
Frank S Dravo
Jacob Friddle
F B Webb
L Washburn
J. W. Jean
I hereby certify that persons whose names are hereto signed were jurors in the case of Chas Johnson convicted of felony at the Nov term 1865

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Chas Johnson
Pardoned 6th Dec 1865
